explosives.rationale: There are no chemical groups associated with explosive properties present in the molecules.

self_reactive_substances.rationale: There are no chemical groups associated with explosive or self-reactive properties present in the molecule.

pyrophoric_solids.rationale: Non-pyrophoric when in contact with air at a room temperature and used as agricultural chemicals.

self_heating_substances.rationale: Test methods applicable to solid (melting point <= 140degC) substances are not available.

substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.hazard_name: Substances and mixtures, which in contact with water, emit flammable gases
substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.rationale: The chemical structure of the substance does not contain metals or metaloids(B, Si, P, Ge, As, Se, Sn, Sb, Te, Bi, Po, At).

oxidizing_solids.rationale: Organic compounds containing oxygen and the oxygen is chemically bonded only to carbon (but not to other elements).

corrosive_to_metals.rationale: Test methods applicable to solid substances are not available.

acute_toxicity_oral.rationale: Because the rat oral LD50s: 68, 147-210, 101-147 and 165-221mg/kg (JMPR375 (1976)) are all within the range of Category 3, the substance was classified as Category 3.

acute_toxicity_dermal.rationale: Dermal LD50 = 500mg/kg in rats and rabbits (both. RTECS (2003)), it was set as Category 3.

acute_toxicity_inhalation_dust.rationale: Based on the value (0.5mg/L) converted from oral LC50 (6h) = 0.3mg/L (JMPR375 (1976), HSDB (2003)) in a rat into exposure for 4 hours, it was set as category 2. In addition, the saturated concentration of this product is about 4*10^(-5)mg/L (4*10^(-3)ppm), it is presumed that the experiment was conducted in the state of the particulate.

skin_corrosion_irritation.rationale: Since irritation was not acknowledged when the this product (5%, 25%, 50% of content) was applied to skin of rabbits (JMPR375 (1976)), it carried out the outside of Category.

serious_eye_damage_irritation.rationale: Since, as for this material formulations (contents is 5%, 25%, 50%), "Mild"irritation was acknowledged for the eyes of the rabbit (JMPR375(1976)), it was set as Category 2B.

respiratory_skin_sensitizer.classification: Respiratory sensitization: Classification not possible; Skin sensitization: Not classified
respiratory_skin_sensitizer.rationale: Respiratory sensitization: no data available. Skin sensitization: in the test (test unknown) using a guinea pig, since there is a description that the sensitization response was not induced (JMPR375(1976), HSDB(2003)), it was taken as the outside of Category.

germ_cell_mutagenicity.rationale: There is the negative result in the dominant fatality test using mouse (JMPR599 (1982)), and the in vivo small core test using rat bone marrow cells (JMPR375 (1976)). So it is classified as the out of the Category. In addition, by Ames test, it is considered as negative, and by in vitro chromosome aberration test, it is considered as positive (JMPR560 (1981)).

carcinogenicity.rationale: The increase of the rate of incidence of a lung tumor (JMPR375 (1976)) or lymph sarcoma (JMPR599 (1982)) were seen in mouse. But it was negative in rats, and the information which will conclude if this substance is carcinogenic was not acquired. Therefore, it was presupposed that data is insufficient and it cannot be classified.

toxic_to_reproduction.rationale: In the reproduction and development tests using rats, mice or rabbit, since the teratogenicity and impact on reproductive potential was not acknowledged (JMPR375 (1976), HSDB (2003)), it was set as the outside of Category.

systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organs/systemic toxicity following single exposure
systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.hazard_statement: May cause damage to organs (nervous system)
systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.rationale: It is known that this product is carbamate pesticides and inhibit cholinesterase activity. Since reduction in cholinesterase activities in humans and rats (JMPR375 (1976), HSDB (2003)) and cholinergic symptoms in human (HSDB (2003)) were observed, it was considered as Category 2 (nervous systems).

systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organs/systemic toxicity following repeated exposure
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_statement: May cause damage to organs (nervous system, blood system) through prolonged or repeated exposure
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.rationale: Since vomiting, salivation, and anemia (decrease of hemoglobin, blood cell volume and erythrocytes etc.) were observed in the repeated administration with the dose level being equivalent to Category 2 with a guidance value to a dog (JMPR375 (1976), JMPR449 (1978), and HSDB (2003)), it was classified into Category 2 (nervous systems, and blood systems).

acute_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: It was classified into Category 1 from 48-hour EC50=0.016mg/L of Crustacea (Daphnia magna) (ECETOC TR91, 2003).

chronic_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_statement: Very toxic to aquatic life with long lasting effects
chronic_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: Classified into Category 1, since acute toxicity was Category 1, supposed not rapidly degrading (BIOWIN), though supposed less bioaccumulative (log Kow=1.7 (PHYSPROP Database, 2005)).
